SEARCH
Package controller

Class PatientController

java.lang.Object
controller.PatientController
All Implemented Interfaces:
UpdateInterface
public class PatientController extends Object implements UpdateInterface
PatientController class manages patient data. This class is responsible for handling operations such as adding, retrieving, updating, and deleting patient information. It follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance exists.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PatientController getInstance()
      Retrieves the single instance of PatientController. If the instance doesn't exist, it is created.
      Returns:
      The single instance of PatientController.

    • setPatients

      public void setPatients(Patient patient)
      Adds a new Patient to the list.
      Parameters:
      patient - The Patient object to be added.

    • getPatients

      public Vector<Vector<String>> getPatients()
      Retrieves all patients as a Vector of Vectors containing strings. Each inner vector represents a patient with their details such as ID, name, disease, etc.
      Returns:
      A Vector of Vectors containing patient data.

    • getCoulmns

      public Vector<String> getCoulmns()
      Retrieves the column names for patient data.
      Returns:
      A Vector of Strings representing column names.

    • populateDummyPatients

      public void populateDummyPatients()
      Populates the patient list with dummy data for testing.

    • update

      public void update(int row, int col, String value)
      Updates a patient's information based on the given row and column.
      Specified by:
      update in interface UpdateInterface
      Parameters:
      row - The row number in the data table.
      col - The column number in the data table.
      value - The new value to be updated.

    • delete

      public void delete(int row)
      Deletes a patient from the list based on the row index.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      row - The row number in the data table to be deleted.
